intro: Galium canum var. laxum, commonly known as slender woodypod, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that disperses seeds through wind and water.
